author: jeffghome2020
title: CardanoOutreach - Africa Focus
description: We have difficulty reaching African Developers due to language gaps. We cannot currently meet with most African students and professors.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very good and perfectly aligns with the objectives of the challenges, although I would like more details regarding how the project would be put into practice. In this challenge, we seek to fund proposals that help expand the Cardano ecosystem to Africa. With this, we would benefit, as our blockchain would become popular, acquire more investors, more participants for Catalyst, perhaps qualified labor to integrate the teams of our catalyst projects, in short, we would grow in every way. And in relation to the African continent, it would also clearly benefit, as its inhabitants would be presented with a sea of ​​possibilities, both in terms of investment, employment and source of income (even if not fixed, what is it like to work being CA and VCA, or something more stable like being a designer or developer of some Dapp, for example). In the proposal in question, there is already a group that teaches about 3400 students, according to the proposer, about Cardano and its technologies. The idea here is summed up by the excerpt: “We want to hire 2 local people to help facilitate the delivery of our educational program to students and teachers in South Africa, Egypt, Nigeria, Kenya and Morocco”. This certainly fits with our goals in this challenge. The issue is that some detail is lacking. What would be the subjects signed? How many classes would be taught? Would they be online, in person? What would be the language spoken? “Our biggest difficulty is finding an educator who doesn't just speak the necessary languages”; which? How would the target audience be captivated to participate in the project and keep attending the various classes? In short, a series of details remained pending, in my view, so that we could clearly understand what needed to be done. In summary, I believe in the potential of this idea and I think it will have a very positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem, mainly because the group is already active, it would not be a bet in the dark, let's say. These people have already been funded and are already producing knowledge about our blockchain for a wide audience, but seeing this does not exclude the need for us to have a very detailed explanation of how this project would develop in a practical way. Therefore, I will give it 4 stars, the note would be maximum if the explanations were more in-depth.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no exact roadmap for the project. We know that 2 teachers will be hired who will extend the teachings on Cardnao to a specific target audience, but we don't know, for example: who these new team members would be, how many classes they would teach, as I said in impact, what the exact topics are addressed... I think it would be important to establish a detailed schedule with dates, specifying what would happen in these 2 months. We know that it takes two months because of the explanation of the salaries of professionals, so the most appropriate thing would be to explain what would happen weekly, for example: month 1, first week: hiring professionals + planning of classes + publicity of the course to be offered. Month 1, second week: first class taught, meeting with students, etc etc. In other words, we deeply understand what would happen and when, in addition to what tasks would be delegated to the new professionals involved and what would be under the responsibility of those who are already part of this team. Now in relation to the budget, they are asking for 3600 dollars, a very small amount compared to most proposals. I think this proposal is a fair investment, as it is not so complex (so many different actions will not be developed in parallel), so it is understandable that the cost is lower. The total amount is shared by the salary of the educators, each one receiving 900 dollars a month, a value well compatible with the market. I think it would be important to ask for an extra amount to be invested in marketing, because since the idea is to expand a course on Cardano, we need some advertising to do that, right? There's not even a budget for advertising, so I'm a little concerned about what this facet of the project would look like. Now in relation to the team, we are very well presented to those involved. We know the name of the professionals, what their main functions are, some examples of what they have done so far, as well as their profiles on social networks, where we can learn more about their background. In relation to this, I think the only thing that remained pending would be to present the professionals hired for the project, I know they will still be selected, but more confidence would be conveyed if this had already been included as well. So I think the feasibility is good as we don't have a detailed roadmap, but we do have a direct and satisfactory explanation of the budget and also the team members. To be perfect feasibility, I suggest that the proposer consider my suggestions and further detail this part of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of the project seems to be in compliance. Regarding the lawsuit, the proponent claims that a separate digital wallet will be created so that the budget usage is traceable. I thought this idea was very good and should be repeated in all proposals, because that is precisely why we work with blockchain: so that everything is done in the most transparent and decentralized way possible. The proponent claims that regular reports are made to Catalyst: this is really what I tend to suggest in my reviews, because it is through written documents that we can access information in a more direct, but synthesized and practical way. The question is, where would these reports be made available? How could the Cardano community see this? This question could be made clearer. With such a question answered, I think that the monitoring of partial results would already be very well done. Now talking about the main goals, I think the proponent suggests several things like: “each presentation has 50 students. Students are already qualified for the fit because they are in the field of informatics (developer) and or business and law, areas where the Cardano Ecosystem lacks talent" and "measure the number of engaged students, the number of references to Catalyst and we want to create new feedback loops to continue engaging our community by introducing innovative communication channels like Tiktok.” How would these students be monitored? An idea that came to me now is that it could be interesting to promote a general meeting, at the end of the project, where some more engaged students could participate and report directly to the Cardano community how their participation in the classes was, what they are doing now, in what way are getting involved in the ecosystem and so on. This part of measuring engagement in new media, such as tiktok, seems to me a little loose in the proposal. Who would? I think a social media role would suit this team well, as they intend to use social media to their advantage. In summary, I believe that the proponent has dedicated a good part of his explanations as alternatives to auditing his project, it is enough to establish a more direct bridge between the team, the data collected and the Cardano community.

f6_assessments.q0: The 'Grow Africa, Grow Cardano' challenge simply seeks to expand Cardano awareness and knowledge throughout Africa. Due to linguistic barriers, this idea implies that contacting African developers is challenging. As a result, the plan proposes to engage local African-speaking developers to promote educational programs in nations including South Africa, Egypt, Nigeria, Kenya, and Morocco, which have the biggest numbers of developers and computer science students in Africa. Getting team members to offer educational programs and onboard talent into the ecosystem would aid in raising Cardano awareness and helping the project achieve its objective of being the blockchain of preference by 2023. The use-case solutions for Cardano technology are also demonstrated in this proposal. Hence, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer provides evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. The proposer has indicated the team required to implement the proposal and has outlined a budget that is quite clear, broken down and reasonable to achieve the set goals. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work considers challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation as well as possible solution to the challenges provided.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides me with sufficient information to audit and evaluate the project's progress toward its stated goals as it elaborates the processes of implementation and the metrics of success measurement given the well-developed material from the impact and feasibility categories

f6_assessments.q0: The localisation aspect of the CardanoOutreach proposal is very much aligned to the challenge brief. This approach empowers local communities in the countries they are targeting - namely: South Africa, Nigeria, Kenya, Morocco and Egypt. The rationale for this is because these aforementioned countries are said to have the highest populations of developers and students studying computer science in Africa. Hence, there is a great opportunity to make impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are several languages spoken in Nigeria for example, however, for the majority, English is a commonly spoken language in Nigeria. So my suggestion is that they find team members that at least speak 'Pidgin' (which is 'broken English' which almost all of the Nigerian population can speak and understand) and perhaps the major languages such as Igbo, Yoruba and Hausa. As for countries like South Africa and Kenya, team members that speak Swahili should be able to cover a decent amount of people as this language is shared. For this reason, I believe they could benefit from 3 additional team members rather than 2 as one can speak Pidgin, one can speak Swahili and then the 3rd can speak Arabic (for Egypt and Morocco).

The salary proposition for the 2 months is good but I would consider 3 new members as mentioned above, so perhaps funds may have to be reallocated. To that end, it would be good to consider additional costs for the team members like electricity/internet which is relatively more expensive. 

Nonetheless, the existing proposing team is strong and they have been awarded funding from previous Project Catalyst funding rounds.
f6_assessments.q2:
The plan is clear, however, the team did not mention where the remaining funds will be allocated. They simply stated the salary of their two incoming team members for which this proposal is for. 

They also mentioned that their feedback loop with regards to impact of their previous campaigns need to be strengthened, e.g. surveying previous students. Perhaps they can implemented a feedback loop plan for this project from the onset to help with capturing the value. 

Additionally, I think it's great that they're looking to start a TikTok channel for Cardano content, I couldn't find it when I searched their proposed username so just in case they haven't made it yet, I suggest they do so they can claim the username before it goes.

In general terms, does this project look pretty simple to implement, doesn't it? I see the requirements you have for these two candidates and how they will help you increase the growth of Cardano in Africa. However, this is clearly a proposal and not a job advertisement, so I would like you to introduce more about your CardanoOutreach family to show investors why you want to develop a blockchain education program in Africa. And above all, I wonder if a talent recruitment project is afraid of facing difficulties of cannot recruit people, how will it develop? Can you think of a way to overcome this problem? Please tell me more.
f6_assessments.q1: As mentioned above, this is a proposal for a serious project, so I hope you can develop a detailed plan and clear milestones. For example, when do you finish hiring people? Where will you survey the labor market first? When will you start leading them on how to teach? After reading this Feasibility part, I want to ask many questions, and I believe investors want to ask even more. Therefore, in addition to the salary for 2 months of work for 2 teachers, please describe in more detail the project's operational roadmap. I will give you 4 points because you have come up with a reasonable budget and membership list. But with such a professional team, I believe you can make this proposal more attractive in the eyes of investors.
f6_assessments.q2: Fortunately, although not the best, you do well at this end and still provide just enough information for the community to follow the project's progress. I see you can also predict the number of students per presentation. I appreciate that. If only you could also get a quantitative index with the number of students engaged and the number of referrals to Catalyst, investors would know more about the success goal you want to aim for. As for your vision of this project's success, I would like you to tell me more about the future of the two teachers because they play an essential role in this project. f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal identifies a critical barrier to Cardano growth in Africa. Development of localized content and tapping educators/ influencers who can speak the language will make it easier to reach students and developers who might be interested in joining the Cardano ecosystem. 

The plan of the proposal is clear. In terms of value added, it is likely limited since it will only tap 2 people. They also admit the risk that finding an educator who is (a) fluent in both English and South African languages and (b) interested in blockchain is going to be difficult. 

To mitigate this risk, they can check two communities in the region. First, the team can take their chances in the engineering academic community. The salary would probably entice a local professor to try it out and it will automatically reach the target students. Another option would be to reach out local non-profits who are active in the youth development and livelihood sector. The colleagues I have worked with in that sector would already be driven, highly skilled, accustomed to working with different nationalities. 
   
There was no information on the proposal on key metrics for this challenge. Based on the duration, budget, and scope, this project is most likely to contribute to expanding reach and Cardano users in Africa. 

There is not enough information in the proposal to deduce ability to scale.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has received funding from three prior Catalyst rounds. It shows continued commitment by its core team to Cardano. The project scope is limited to hiring team members who will be able to help them bridge the language barrier to its target African countries. The budget allocation was 100% for salaries of the new team members and it is reasonable. 

I verified the media link included in the proposal and it is a youtube channel of Benjay Invest. I assume that this is the sample content they developed, and the channel has ~1.6k subscribers. If this is their proof of concept for the project, it brings to question longevity of the program given that new content has stopped in the past 5 months, which is a shame since the Cardano dapps have been launching this year. I tried to reach the team for clarification in the comments section but I did not get a reply. 

The budget is reasonable for the specific task. The team mentioned the duration is 60 days. However, that is likely 60 days after they are able to hire the people with needed skills.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has another, almost identical proposal in Grow India, Grow Cardano, except for the replacement of words that relate geographically to India with those that relate to Africa. 
As such, my reviews will naturally also be very similar since they are in regards to almost identical proposals.
The proposal is aiming to hire 2 additional Afro Asiatic speaking developers for a period of 2 months, in order to promote the educational program he and his team have been working on with funds from previous Catalyst rounds.
The main question arising from the goal of this proposal, is why hasn’t this been foreseen in the previous funds and budgeted accordingly, especially since in the previous round the proposer mentions “When this conduit matures, we will be able to sustain the project without further funding from the Project (ideally by Fund8). This is our LAST Funding request before we are SELF SUSTAINABLE ” . Since this was a statement from a funded proposal, the question arrises if this will keep repeating in the future.
Otherwise, there is no mention on the success of the material to be translated, and why it would be important to have it in as many languages as possible.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has provided sufficient info about themselves with links attached to their expertise, the budget is also clearly described, as it’s not very complex - $900 for each educator for a period of 2 months - and the timeline is succinct but considering the task at hand, it is sufficient.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has enough information to be properly assessed in its progress. The team has provided sufficient info for the metrics of project development, reporting to Catalyst, public wallet to verify payments, number of participating students, etc.
Yet for the success description there are no clearly defined numbers provided, that could be used as milestones for the community to be able to independently assess its success.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement is very clear and hits the critical issues of the challenge. However, I stand to constructively argue the effectiveness of the proposal because per the approach, the team wants to hire local African developers to execute the project in the stated countries. What if those to be hired are not up to the task, what then happens to the proposal? Projects of this nature require experts to effectively execute them so that the challenge objectives can be realized. The gap I am seeing here, makes it difficult for me to ascertain how best the proposal effectively address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Per the team’s relevant experience and expertise I believe the team is in a best position to execute the project. The budget lacks some detailing, it’s not well presented to easily identify how the funds would be used. The amount I can see there is $900 with no explicit arithmetic calculation on how the total budget, $3600 is realized. The plan presented here is not so detailed to tell how the project would be executed however, the timeline is clear and definite. The challenge/risk presented here is more of a need than a risk. I’ll advise that an appropriate foreseeable skill employed so that actual risk/challenges can be stated in future proposals.
I will say that, the proposal to some extent can’t be implemented considering some of these issues identified.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap is not so detailed, milestones are not clear however the time horizon is definite.
The problem described in the proposal is clear however the proposed solution is kind of lacking some critical ingredients like the remoteness of the team from execution locations and hiring local African speaking developers who might not actually possess the required expertise to execute the task. However, the metrics/KPIs are good indicators of success evaluation considering that amongst others they tell the number of students at each presentation.

solution: Our funded project needs to hire local African speaking developers to promote our educational program to the various countries listed below.
experience: We are a fund 4/6/7 Project Catalyst winner.  I manage a team of 5 people who deliver educational content to students and professors. Our MVP has introduced 3,400 students to the Cardano Ecosystem. I am a semi retired university grad with extensive management experience.
